info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued May 28 at 1:34AM PDT until May 29 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM PDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 9 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Cascades. This includes Crater Lake, Highways 138, 230, and 62 near Crater and Diamond lakes and Highway 58 near Odell and Crescent lakes. * WHEN...From 8 PM Saturday to 11 AM PDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Roads may become slick and snow-covered. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest rates will be late Saturday night through very early Sunday morning. With seasonably warm road surfaces, snow should mostly melt by mid to late morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
